page.topic: PhoneGap - Sound Effects using Native Sounds
page.description: This Cordova template application shows how to add sound effects to an application. It requires the 'Low Latency Audio' and the 'Status' bar plugins.

discussion.p: Sound effects can be integrated in to applications using the 'Low Latency Audio' plugin which is integrated into Alpha Anywhere. The Low Latency Audio plugin enables multi-channel and multi-voice playback and uses caching to minimize playback latency by leveraging the native audio APIs available on mobile devices. While HTML5 offers audio in mobile browsers, the quality is poor.

The *[ui:PhoneGap - Sound Effect using Native Sounds]* template demonstrates using the 'Low Latency Audio' plugin to take advantage of native audio on a mobile device. When the sound file have been downloaded, unzip the sound files to the project folder.

description.p: When building the Cordova application, make sure to select the *[ui:Additional files]* property to add the sound files to the project. section.description: When the app is launched, it will programmatically play some sounds. All sounds can also be played using the buttons.
section.note: Sounds will not work in Live or Working Preview. The app must be installed on a mobile device in order to play sounds.
